dare: Sing the chorus of your favorite song in a high-pitched voice.
Do 20 push-ups right now.
Text your crush: “I really like pineapples. Thoughts?” and don’t add context for 10 minutes.
Eat a spoonful of hot sauce or mustard—your choice.
Try to juggle three random objects for one minute.
Speak in pirate slang until your next turn.
Let someone draw a funny mustache on your face with washable marker.
Do your best chicken dance for 60 seconds.
Open your last photo and explain it to everyone in dramatic detail.
Attempt to lick your elbow (and keep trying for 30 seconds).
Post an unfiltered selfie to your story with the caption “Feeling cute, might delete later.”
Wear socks on your hands until the round ends.
Balance a book on your head and walk across the room without dropping it.
Read the next text message you receive out loud in an opera voice.
Call a random contact and sing them “Happy Birthday,” no matter the month.
Do your best celebrity impression until someone guesses who it is.
Let the person to your left redo your hair any way they like for the next 10 minutes.
Try to say the alphabet backward as fast as you can.
Hold an ice cube in each hand until they melt completely.
Put on a blindfold and identify three items by smell alone.
Do your best catwalk strut across the room and back.
Speak only in rhymes until your next turn.
Eat a cracker and try to whistle right after.
Let the group pick a new nickname for you and use it for the rest of the game.
Do a plank until someone counts to 60 (out loud, slowly).
Recite a tongue twister three times perfectly or start over.
Wrap yourself in toilet paper like a mummy in under two minutes.
Attempt a handstand (or wall-assisted handstand) for 10 seconds.
Wear your shirt backward for the next three rounds.
Let someone send an emoji of their choice from your phone to your top contact.
Do your best imitation of a baby learning to walk for one minute.
Attempt to make everyone laugh in the next 30 seconds. If no one laughs, do 20 jumping jacks.
Gargle a song of the group’s choice and have them guess what it is.
Swap an item of clothing with the person on your right for two rounds.
Eat a bite of a plain lemon without making a face.
Compose a short rap about the person across from you and perform it.
Do your best impression of a famous movie villain.
Speak with your tongue sticking out until your next turn.
Let the group choose a word you can’t say for the rest of the game; every time you slip, do a squat.
Post the fifth photo in your camera roll to your story without explanation for 10 minutes.
Do your best attempt at breakdancing for 20 seconds.
Let someone else send a voice note from your phone saying only “Guess what?” then nothing else.
Attempt to spin around 10 times and walk in a straight line.
Put as many marshmallows (or similar snacks) in your mouth as you can and say, “I am the marshmallow king/queen.”
Draw a self-portrait with your non-dominant hand and show everyone.
Try to whistle with crackers in your mouth.
Hold a yoga tree pose until your next turn.
Say two honest compliments to the person on your left.
Do your best impression of a siren for 30 seconds.
Wear a pair of shoes on your hands for the next round.
Let another player redo one of your social media bios (leave it for at least 30 minutes).
Talk in an exaggerated fake accent chosen by the group until your next turn.
Attempt to breakdance for 15 seconds.
Do 10 burpees as fast as you can.
Brush your teeth with no toothpaste, using your finger as the brush.
Blindfold yourself and try to identify three people just by touching their hair.
Hold a smile without breaking it for two minutes straight.
Take a silly selfie and set it as your phone wallpaper for the rest of the game.
Let the group rearrange the apps on your phone’s home screen.
Do your best commercial voiceover for the drink or snack you’re holding.
Have a full conversation with a piece of furniture for one minute.
Draw a mustache on your finger and use it to narrate the next round.
Let someone give you a temporary marker tattoo on your arm.
Eat a spoonful of ketchup mixed with sugar.
Try to do 15 seconds of stand-up comedy about the last movie you watched.
Hop on one foot while naming five countries starting with ‘S’.
Pour a small cup of water on your head.
Attempt to moonwalk across the room.
Let the group pick a sentence you must text to your sibling or parent.
Pretend to be a robot whose batteries are running out—for one full minute.
Make up a handshake with the person next to you and perform it perfectly.
Wear two different shoes for the next three rounds.
Hold your breath while naming five cartoon characters.
Eat a food combination suggested by the group (nothing dangerous!).
Do your best runway model turn at the end of the room.
Let someone else style your eyebrows (with safe makeup) for the next hour.
Use your foot to write your name on a sheet of paper.
Act like a dog and fetch an item the group chooses.
Talk without using the letter ‘e’ until your next turn.
Do 10 push-ups while singing ‘Twinkle Twinkle Little Star’.
Spin around while reciting the days of the week backward.
Let the group add one item to your online shopping cart (you don’t have to buy it).
Attempt to stand on one leg with your eyes closed for 30 seconds.
Imitate the person on your right for the next five minutes.
Eat a slice of bread covered in hot sauce.
Pretend you’re an infomercial host selling the nearest object for one minute.
Do your best slow-motion run across the room like in an action movie.
Let the group pick an emoji that you must include in every text you send for the next hour.
Attempt to hula-hoop with an invisible hoop for one minute.
Speak in song lyrics only until your next turn.
Let someone send a GIF of their choice to your most recent contact.
Balance a spoon on your nose for as long as possible.
Act like you’re stuck in an invisible box for 30 seconds.
Do 15 frog jumps across the room.
Wrap a scarf or towel around your neck like a superhero cape and strike heroic poses for 60 seconds.
Let the person to your left redo your phone’s lock-screen photo.
Attempt to draw the person across from you with your eyes closed.
Try to tie a cherry stem (or shoelace) into a knot using only your tongue.
Walk backward everywhere you go until it’s your turn again.
Recite the first 10 digits of π; for each mistake, do a jumping jack.
Wear sunglasses indoors until the next round.
Let someone style your hair into a silly shape using only their hands—no tools.
Do your best impression of a sports commentator narrating everyday life for one minute.
Sing everything you say for the next five minutes.
Hold a wall sit while naming all seven continents.
Let the group write one word on each of your cheeks (washable marker).
Attempt to eat a snack with chopsticks—even if you don’t have chopsticks, improvise with pencils.
Make a funny face and hold it for 45 seconds.
Tell a joke so bad it’s good; if no one groans, tell another.
Wear a paper towel roll or toilet paper roll as a bracelet until your next turn.
Do your best impression of your favorite movie character ordering coffee.
Allow the group to shuffle your playlist and play the next song loudly for 30 seconds, no skipping!
Mime your favorite hobby for one minute; no talking.
Try to keep a straight face while the group attempts to make you laugh for 60 seconds.
Let someone else post a single random word on your social media story.
Balance a plastic cup or small book on your head while walking around the table once.
